docs.snippet: The European Union will start disintegrating after Italians pick the anti-establishment 5-Star Movement candidate as mayor of Rome on June 19 and Britons vote to leave the EU four days later, the leader of the UK Independence Party was quoted as s...
docs.lead_paragraph: The European Union will start disintegrating after Italians pick the anti-establishment 5-Star Movement candidate as mayor of Rome on June 19 and Britons vote to leave the EU four days later, the leader of the UK Independence Party was quoted as saying.

headline.main: Brexit Campaigner Farage Says UK, Italy to Launch EU's Disintegration
headline.print_headline: Brexit Campaigner Farage Says UK, Italy to Launch EU's Disintegration

docs.snippet: My boy aspires to become president. But I wonder if anti-Muslim vitriol is ruining that ambition....
docs.lead_paragraph: My boy aspires to become president. But I wonder if anti-Muslim vitriol is ruining that ambition.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by professor and Pakistani immigrant Muhammad H Zaman expresses concern about impact of 2016 presidential campaign on his young son's idealism about American political process, particularly in light of Donald Trump's demonizing of immigrants, particularly Muslims, for political gain.

docs.snippet: In countries like Slovakia and Hungary, vigilante groups are portraying a menacing incursion of asylum seekers to build support for their xenophobic agendas....
docs.lead_paragraph: In countries like Slovakia and Hungary, vigilante groups are portraying a menacing incursion of asylum seekers to build support for their xenophobic agendas.
docs.abstract: Vigilante groups in Slovakia, Hungary and Bulgaria are patrolling borders, streets and other public areas to defend against what they see as menacing incursion of asylum seekers, many of them Muslims from Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and other poor, war-torn nations; authorities are worried about continuing presence of such groups even as flow of refugees through many of these countries has all but stopped.

headline.main: Vigilantes Patrol Parts of Europe Where Few Migrants Set Foot
headline.print_headline: Vigilantes Patrol Where Few Migrants Set Foot

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

byline.contributor: Miroslava Germanova reported from Bratislava; Boryana Dzhambazova from Sofia, Bulgaria; and Helene Bienvenu from Budapest.
byline.original: By MIROSLAVA GERMANOVA, BORYANA DZHAMBAZOVA and HELENE BIENVENU

docs.snippet: Distrustful of the government’s response to the 2014 Sewol disaster, victims’ families have camped out on a rocky island to monitor the salvage operation....
docs.lead_paragraph: Distrustful of the government’s response to the 2014 Sewol disaster, victims’ families have camped out on a rocky island to monitor the salvage operation.
docs.abstract: Parents of South Korean schoolchildren who perished in 2014 sinking of ferry Sewol have been keeping watch since summer of 2015 over salvage operations off country's southwest coast; most have expressed distrust of government's investigation into incident that killed 304 people, 250 of whom were teenagers on school trip.

headline.main: South Korean Families Watch Ferry’s Salvaging, Hoping Truth Surfaces
headline.print_headline: South Korean Families Watch Ferry’s Salvaging, Hoping the Truth Surfaces
